questions.question: An instrument detects the presence of electric current in the circuit, is known as,
In a D’Arsonval galvanometer what is the purpose of using iron core between two pole faces?

answers.a: The effect of stray magnetic field is reduced
answers.b: Moment of inertia of moving parts become smaller
answers.d: Flux density in the air gap becomes high, causing large deflecting torque

questions.question: Which is the most common absolute instrument that gives the measured current in form of tangent of deflected angle?
Galvanometer connected with high resistance in series is used as
Sometimes D’Arsonval galvanometer do not use ferromagnetic cores between the poles of permanent magnet, in this case,

answers.a: The flux density becomes smaller, resulting in low deflecting torque
answers.b: The dimension of moving coil can be made smaller, thereby reducing Moment of inertia.
answers.c: The magnetic field may not be radial, resulting in a non-uniform scale even if spring control is used.
